body: My plan is to tender no matter what in late January (Unless a miracle from the co. with imminent large profits).

$PQEFF If you don't understand the significance of the TomCo interview and why they are drilling conventional oil wells I think it is because of oil reserves. Conventional oilwell technology is very well known and if they do the exploration work work and geology surveys they will get proven reserves classification right away which will give them instant access to financing. In the case of the oil sands portion that FEED results just recently confirmed the technology so I believe PQE has to apply to a US department in charge of oil reserves classifcation which they probably did when they got the FEED results
created_at: since it is a new technology it will take some time for the US department to classify the reserves as P1 or P2 which in turn allows PQE (and by extension TomCo) to finance the building of the plant in very favorable terms. In PQE's case there are 80M barrels of accessible oil (at $80 per barrel that reserve would be $6.4B worth) easy plant financing after that happens.
